title: Pitch deck outline for Aerospace Series A startups
summary: Series A aerospace pitch decks must demonstrate meaningful progress from seed while presenting a credible path to production and revenue. Lead with technical accomplishments and customer traction. Show you've de-risked the business and have a clear execution plan. Pitchchat turns your deck into an interactive pitch room for investors.

sections.title: Accomplishments & Traction
sections.goal: Open with your strongest proof points
sections.guidance: Lead with what you've achieved since seed: TRL advancement, customer commitments, regulatory progress, team scaling. Show momentum and milestone achievement. Include key metrics: contract value, technical performance, cost improvements. This slide should demonstrate you execute.

sections.title: Technology & Product
sections.guidance: Present your technology with evidence of validation: test data, demonstration results, performance specifications. Show competitive advantage with technical specificity. Address remaining technical risks and mitigation plans. Include development roadmap to production readiness.

sections.title: Market & Opportunity
sections.goal: Frame the market opportunity with customer evidence
sections.guidance: Size your market bottom-up based on specific customer segments and validated willingness to pay. Show market timing drivers: why customers need this now. Include customer quotes and evidence of demand. Address market evolution and your positioning as it develops.

sections.title: Customer Traction
sections.goal: Prove commercial demand with concrete evidence
sections.guidance: Present your customer pipeline: contracts signed, orders committed, pilots in progress. Show customer logos and commitment values. Include testimonials on why customers chose you. Address sales cycle dynamics and pipeline conversion. This is critical for Series A credibility.

sections.title: Business Model & Economics
sections.goal: Demonstrate path to profitable unit economics
sections.guidance: Present your pricing model and unit economics at scale. Show cost trajectory from prototype to production. Include gross margin evolution and break-even analysis. Address working capital dynamics given aerospace payment cycles. Show you understand the business, not just the technology.

sections.title: Manufacturing & Operations
sections.goal: Show credible path from prototype to production
sections.guidance: Present manufacturing strategy: approach, facility plans, supplier relationships. Show MRL progression and key manufacturing milestones. Address production cost targets and capital requirements. Include operational readiness plan. This differentiates real companies from science projects.

sections.title: Regulatory Status
sections.goal: Demonstrate regulatory progress and clear path forward
sections.guidance: Present regulatory achievements and timeline to completion. Show any certifications obtained or in progress. Address regulatory risks and mitigation. Include any government relationships that support regulatory progress. This is often gating to revenueâ€”show you've made real progress.

sections.title: Competitive Landscape
sections.goal: Position against a more developed competitive field
sections.guidance: Updated competitive analysis showing evolution since seed. Include win/loss data against specific competitors. Show technical benchmarking where you have advantages. Address new entrants or incumbent moves. Demonstrate deepening moat.

sections.title: Team & Organization
sections.goal: Show team scaling and organizational capability
sections.guidance: Present team growth since seed and current organizational structure. Highlight key hires and their impact. Show hiring plan for this round with specific roles. Address organizational challenges of scaling. Include advisors and board if relevant.

sections.title: Financial Plan & Ask
sections.goal: Present clear path to Series B milestones
sections.guidance: Show financial projections through production ramp. Present this round's milestones and use of funds. Define Series B bar and your plan to exceed it. Include total capital path estimate. Show capital efficiency compared to industry benchmarks. Close with clear ask and conviction.
